TextView.android:text: This application should be used on 2 devices simultaneously. In order to do that, the first step is Network Discovery: in 'Server Mode' with the 'Start Server' button you can start the server. After that, on the other device switch to 'Client Mode', and with the 'Start Discovery' button the client will be started. It doesn't matter which device is the server or the client. If your devices are on the same Wi-fi network, they should find each other. After the connection is established, 2 buttons called 'Watch a directory' and 'File transfer' will be enabled.

Choose a directory to 'watch' (ORIGIN path). If you move a file / folder to the given path, the program will notice , then will synchronize the files to the marked folder on the other device (TARGET path). Usage is similar to the Network Discovery: with the 'Start Server' you start the directory watching , then in the other device switch to 'Client Mode' to 'Start Client', which designate where the files will be transferred. When you finished , before exit press 'Check failed files' because this will check if some file failed during the process, then send them again.

Choose a directory, then transfer the newer or non existable files to the other device. Usage is similar to the Network Discovery: with the 'Start Server' you determine the path where the files will be transferred (TARGET path). In the other device switch to 'Client Mode' to 'Start Client', then files in this directory will be transferred to the other device (ORIGIN path).
